did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Architectural records of Nancy Florence (1935-2015), an architect in Southern California and early member of the Organization for Women Architects and Design Professionals (OWA).

p.emph: Please note: The current finding aid includes only minimal description of the collection. If you have questions, please contact Special Collections (specref@vt.edu) for more information.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Born in Los Angeles, Nancy Florence(1935-2015) was an architectural designer based in Southern California. She ewas among the earliest memebrs of the Organization of Women Architects (founded in 1973) and joined the 1975 cohort of the Women's School of Planning and Architecture at St. Joseph's College in Biddeford, Maine. She graduated from the University of California at Berkeley in 1982 with a professional degree in architecture. Appointed to the California Board of Architects by Governer Jerry Brown in 1976, she advocated for gender equity in architectural licensing. She was one of the first public members to serve on the commission. In the late 1980s, Nancy Florence established an independent practice nameed "The Design Collaborative." Her work included residential designs throughout California and the Northwest. Before opening her own practice, Florence interned at the San Luis Obispo Solar Group.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This includes business records, architectural drawings, design sketches, correspondence, photographs, and materials catalogs related to several residential projects. Also included are class lecture notes, promotional materials, and assignments from coursework at UC Berkeley and WSPA.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged according to Shepherd and Lowell's "Standard Series and Subseries for Architecture and Landscape Design Records."
